ratings.comment: There is no confusion about where he stands politically (liberal atheist). Although I do not agree with most of his rants, when he actually gets to the material he is a good teacher. His exams and homework are fair. The only reason I didn't get an A is because I didn't do one of the assignments worth 5% of my grade.

Worst instructor ever. Class is mostly just a soap box for his political rants. When he finally gets to energy economics, he spends entire classes on REALLY BASIC economic concepts (like the supply & demand curves), but hardly any time at all clearly explaining more difficult energy and economic concepts that he actually tests on. Ugh.

He teaches through stories from history and current events which helps keep students' attention. Homework is easy and he gives lots of help if you need it. Quizzes are a little hard, but fairly graded. He is always willing to accept an incorrect answer if it has a good argument behind it. I don't like economics, but I liked this class a lot.

Professor is smart and knows his stuff well. Other than sometimes diverging to his own little world, he is very clear and concise. I was expecting the course to be deep and hard, but it was really easy. Just go to class and take GOOD notes. Later review your notes and you'll get an A for sure.

The most random class I've ever taken. It's hard to decide what's important for tests and homework is difficult and rather irrelevant. He fell asleep during my presentation and did sudokus during all the other presentations. Really?

He is a good professor as far as knowing his material, keeping his "lecture" interesting.  However, it is very hard to figure out what is relevant as far as tests!  ALOT OF ALGEBRA in his energy class!
Shaten helped me to recognize aspects of energy issues that politicans and energy companies try to hide from the general public.

Shaten tends to give lots of anecdotes and interesting backround to the subjects, but isn't so great about being clear on what's important to remember.  He is a pretty cool guy who cares about his subject (energy policy/economics) but a harder grader than I would have thought.

I expected 671 to be lot more interesting than the other Econ classes. Prepares good lectures. He tends to reiterate his rhetoric and you may be put off by that; I thought it made the class more fun. Makes for fun discussion and analysis.
